items.title: New health and safety requirements for COVID-19 testing sites that collect and send specimens off-site
items.summary: SF’s Health Officer issued a new Health Order requiring privately run COVID-19 testing sites that collect specimens and send off-site for processing to follow new health and safety requirements in the collection of specimens.

items.title: New data shows SF COVID-19 cases in decline following Omicron-driven surge
items.summary: Even as the City reached highest number of cases yet during the pandemic, businesses, schools, and essential services remained open demonstrating that by layering defenses SF can successfully manage the virus.

items.title: COVID-19 testing capacity at an all-time high
items.summary: COVID-19 testing capacity is at an all-time high, even as impacts on staffing and laboratories temporarily affect hours at four city testing sites.

items.title: New data shows next several weeks critical in beating back COVID-19 surge and protecting SF's essential services
items.summary: Health officials urge San Franciscans to get boosted and lower their risk exposure where possible as City prioritizes protecting essential services and vulnerable populations.

items.title: SFDPH updates COVID-19 isolation and quarantine recommendations following changes from the state
items.summary: Today, the San Francisco Department of Public Health (SFDPH) announced updated recommendations of Isolation and Quarantine in alignment with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and California Department of Public Health (CDPH).

items.title: SFDPH reaffirms support for in-person learning despite presence of COVID-19 Omicron variant
items.summary: Health and safety protocols have kept schools open despite the pandemic and are further encouraged as students and staff return to school following the holidays.

items.title: SF temporarily tightens universal indoor masking requirement & augments vaccination requirements amid Omicron surge
items.summary: Indoor mega-events will require up-to-date vaccinations, including boosters, starting February 1, 2022.
